results.adx_keywords: Decisions and Verdicts;Newtown, Conn, Shooting (2012);Compensation for Damages (Law);Jones, Alex (1974- )
results.title: ‘Do these people actually think they’re getting any money?’ Jones denounces the verdict, and fund-raises.
results.abstract: Broadcasting in tandem with the court hearing, Alex Jones called the $965 million judgment against him a “joke,” and urged his viewers to send him hundreds of thousands of dollars to pay for an appeal.

media.caption: Alex Jones with private security guards after appearing at his Sandy Hook defamation trial last week.

results.adx_keywords: Frauds and Swindling;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Trump, Donald J;James, Letitia;Trump Organization;New York State
results.byline: By Ben Protess, Jonah E. Bromwich and William K. Rashbaum
results.title: Trump Forms New Company, Drawing Scrutiny From N.Y. Attorney General
results.abstract: The New York attorney general, Letitia James, who is suing the former president, questioned his motive for forming a new company, which will be known in the state as the Trump Organization II.

media.caption: Under scrutiny by the New York attorney general, Donald J. Trump’s business created a new company in Delaware.
media.copyright: Bridget Bennett for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Global Warming;Real Estate and Housing (Residential);Hurricane Ian (2022);Homeowners Insurance;Mortgages;Florida
results.title: Why Ian May Push Florida Real Estate Out of Reach for All but the Super Rich
results.abstract: The hurricane’s record-breaking cost will make it even harder for many to get insurance, experts say — threatening home sales, mortgages and construction.

media.caption: Cleanup in the aftermath of Hurricane Ian in Fort Myers Beach, Fla., on Oct. 5.
media.copyright: Callaghan O'Hare for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: City Councils;Black People;Discrimination;Hispanic-Americans;Appointments and Executive Changes;Politics and Government;Race and Ethnicity;Martinez, Nury;Los Angeles (Calif)
results.byline: By Jill Cowan and Shawn Hubler
results.title: Los Angeles City Councilwoman Resigns Amid Uproar Over Racist Remarks
results.abstract: The former Council president, Nury Martinez, faced calls from state leaders and President Biden to leave office after making racist remarks on a recording that emerged on Sunday.

media.caption: The former Los Angeles City Council president Nury Martinez during a news conference in Los Angeles last month. Ms. Martinez announced her resignation as a councilwoman on Wednesday.
media.copyright: Al Seib/Los Angeles Times via Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Decisions and Verdicts;Executive Privilege, Doctrine of;Search and Seizure;Classified Information and State Secrets;Trump, Donald J;Dearie, Raymond J;Supreme Court (US);Justice Department
results.title: Supreme Court Rejects Trump Request to Intervene in Documents Case
results.abstract: Without any noted dissents, the court issued a one-sentence statement that amounted to a rebuke to the former president.

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump has often been infuriated by what he sees as a lack of deference to him by the Supreme Court, to which he has appointed three justices.
media.copyright: Bridget Bennett for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Minimum Wage;Labor and Jobs;Wages and Salaries;Tips and Tipping;Workplace Hazards and Violations;Restaurants;Law and Legislation;Regulation and Deregulation of Industry
results.title: Battle Over Wage Rules for Tipped Workers Is Heating Up
results.abstract: A system counting tips toward the minimum wage is being fought in many places. Critics say it’s often abused. Defenders say workers benefit overall.

media.caption: Base wages for tipped employees, who primarily work in the food and drinks service industry, remain low.

results.adx_keywords: Attacks on Police;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Police;Deaths (Fatalities);Bristol (Conn)
results.byline: By Michael Gold, Corey Kilgannon and Hurubie Meko
results.title: 2 Police Officers Killed in Connecticut After a Suspicious 911 Call
results.abstract: A third officer was seriously wounded in the violence in Bristol, officials said, and a suspect also died. The police chief called it an act of “senseless violence.”

results.adx_keywords: Fishing, Sport;Cheating;Runyan, Jacob (1980- );Cominsky, Chase;Cleveland (Ohio);Cuyahoga County (Ohio);Lake Erie
results.title: Ohio Fishing Duo Charged With Cheating and Attempted Grand Theft
results.abstract: The pair had stuffed walleye fish with lead balls at an Ohio fishing tournament last month in an attempt to win nearly $30,000, prosecutors said.

media.caption: Jacob Runyan and Chase Cominsky, center left and center right, after they won a previous tournament in April.
media.copyright: Isaac Ritchey/The Blade, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Long Covid;Chronic Condition (Health);Research;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Disease Rates;your-feed-healthcare;Nature Communications (Journal)
results.title: Nearly Half of Covid Patients Haven’t Fully Recovered Months Later, Study Finds
results.abstract: The findings strengthened calls from scientists for more expansive care options for long Covid patients.

media.caption: A study tracked 33,000 Scottish people who had tested positive for the virus and 63,000 who had never been diagnosed with Covid, checking symptoms at six-month intervals.

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);United States Politics and Government;Third-Party Politics (US);Elections, Senate;Presidential Election of 2020;Conservatism (US Politics);Lee, Michael S (1971- );McMullin, Evan;Romney, Mitt;Republican Party;Senate;Utah
results.title: In Utah, a Trump Loyalist Sends an S.O.S. to Romney, of All People
results.abstract: Senator Mike Lee, in a surprisingly close race for re-election, has antagonized Mitt Romney and the state’s G.O.P. for years. His plea now? “Please, get on board.”

media.caption: Senator Mike Lee played a key role in trying to help Donald J. Trump subvert the 2020 election, while his fellow Republican Utah senator, Mitt Romney, was in staunch opposition.
media.copyright: Kim Raff for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Doctors;Names, Personal;Discrimination;Women and Girls;Medicine and Health;E-Mail;Research;your-feed-science;your-feed-healthcare;your-feed-health;JAMA Network Open
results.title: ‘Kind of Awkward’: Doctors Find Themselves on a First-Name Basis
results.abstract: While many physicians may avoid discussing the subject, a study showed that who gets addressed with the honorific “Dr.” may depend on gender, degree and specialty.

media.caption: “Use of formal titles in medicine and many other professions is a linguistic signal of respect and professionalism,” two doctors wrote.
media.copyright: Brittany Greeson for The New York Times

results.title: Judge Holds Prison Officials in Contempt for Treatment of Terminally Ill Inmate
results.abstract: In an extraordinary rebuke, a federal judge in Florida said officials misled a court to block the compassionate release of prisoner who was dying of cancer.

media.caption: A photograph released by the court of Frederick Mervin Bardell in the hospital.
media.copyright: U.S. District Court for the Middle District of Florida

results.adx_keywords: Sex Crimes;#MeToo Movement;Gooding, Cuba Jr;Manhattan (NYC)
results.title: Cuba Gooding Jr. Will Serve No Prison Time After Plea in Sex Abuse Case
results.abstract: The actor pleaded guilty to a single harassment charge after three women accused him of unwanted touching. A score of similar stories emerged after his arrest.

media.caption: The criminal case against Cuba Gooding Jr. is over, but two civil suits against him continue.
media.copyright: Jefferson Siegel for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Endorsements;Elections, Senate;Laxalt, Adam;Masto, Catherine Cortez;Republican Party;Arizona
results.title: Family of Republican Senate Candidate in Nevada Endorses His Opponent
results.abstract: The Republican candidate, Adam Laxalt, built his political career on his family name. Some of his relatives are now hoping they can put an end to that career.

media.caption: Adam Laxalt, a Republican running for Senate in Nevada, arriving at a rally with former President Donald J. Trump on Saturday.
media.copyright: Bridget Bennett for The New York Times

results.byline: By Maggie Haberman and Alan Feuer
results.title: Trump Aide Was Seen on Security Footage Moving Boxes at Mar-a-Lago
results.abstract: The aide, Walt Nauta, moved the boxes from a storage room before and after the Justice Department issued a subpoena demanding the return of all classified documents held by the former president.

media.caption: The Justice Department had subpoenaed security camera footage from former President Donald J. Trump’s Mar-a-Lago residence in Palm Beach, Fla.
media.copyright: Saul Martinez for The New York Times

results.title: Christie, Recalling Sandy, Questions DeSantis’s Views on Hurricane Aid
results.abstract: Mr. Christie noted that Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida sought help after Hurricane Ian despite having voted against aid for Hurricane Sandy in 2013.

media.caption: Chris Christie, the former governor of New Jersey, questioned whether Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida would stick to the principles he held as a congressman regarding hurricane aid.
media.copyright: Nicole Craine for The New York Times

results.byline: By Eliza Shapiro and Brian M. Rosenthal
results.title: Hasidic School Is Breaking State Education Law, N.Y. Official Rules
results.abstract: Issued amid a lawsuit brought by a parent who left the community, the determination could signal challenges for scores of Hasidic Jewish schools.

media.caption: Yeshiva Mesivta Arugath Habosem, an all-boys Hasidic school in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, is not complying with a state education law requiring private schools to offer basic secular studies.

results.title: Hochul Leads Zeldin by 10 Points in Marist Poll, as G.O.P. Sees Hope
results.abstract: Gov. Kathy Hochul, a Democrat, enjoys a healthy lead in New York, but Republican leaders are showing signs of cautious optimism that the race might be competitive.

media.caption: Among likely voters, Representative Lee Zeldin trailed Gov. Kathy Hochul by eight percentage points.
media.copyright: Spencer Platt/Getty Images, Anna Watts for The New York Times

results.title: F.D.A. Confirms Widespread Shortages of Adderall
results.abstract: The agency cited Teva’s continuing supply problems as well as those of other drug makers struggling to fill the gap.

media.caption: The F.D.A. cited manufacturing delays at the Israeli drug manufacturer Teva as a cause of the shortage.

results.title: The ‘Sleeping Giant’ That May Decide the Midterms
